data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 10 steps forward, 9 steps left, 10 steps forward, 9 steps right, 10 steps backward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When you turn around, you are gonna be turning right 4 times. So, the answer is No.

You take 4 steps for the first step. 4 steps from the starting point for the second step. 1/10 = 0.1. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take one step to make the beginning point the same as the ending point. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you start at the beginning and get 10 steps you turn left at the starting point. If you turn from the beginning to the beginning and get 3 and 3 steps you get 10 steps, turn right at the starting point and repeat. So, the answer is yes.

A person who always faces forward cannot take any action back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

Turning left gives you a direction change to the right. If you change directions, your direction changes backward, and your direction changes forward. If you change direction backward, your direction changes backward, and your direction changes forward. If you change direction forward, your direction changes backward, and your direction changes forward. Thus, the answer is No.
